did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Collection consists of invoice books, ledger books, and 82 file folders documenting backstage catering for performers ranging across many musical genres: rock 'n roll, punk, heavy metal, R&B, Jazz, and country.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Stageside Services was a catering company based in Seattle, Washington. Owned and operated by Monica Di Meo, the company specialized in servicing catering needs for many of Seattle's music venues, such as the Music Hall Theater, Firehouse, Seattle Center Arena, Paramount, Eagles Hippodrome, and the Tacoma Dome. Stateside services provided primarily food and drink catering, but also laundry services and backstage furnishings. The company later added film productions to their scope of services.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of 2 invoice books, 5 ledger books, and 82 file folders documenting backstage catering for performers ranging across many musical genres: rock 'n roll, punk, heavy metal, R&B, Jazz, and country. Files contain notes on food and dressing room requirements, a copy of the contract rider, miscellaneous receipts/invoices, and occasional notes or correspondence. Artists represented include Bon Jovi, David Bowie, Rick James, Joan Jett, Elton John, Judas Priest, the Kinks, Kool and the Gang, Madonna, Metallica, Motley Crue, Eddie Murphy, Tom Petty, Pink Floyd, the Police, the Pretenders, Queen, Lionel Ritchie, Rush, Talking Heads, James Taylor, Tina Turner, U2, Van Halen, and many others.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Rock Music Catering papers, #8592. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

arrangement.head: COLLECTION ARRANGEMENT
arrangement.p: File folders are organized by individual artist or band name.

emph.ref: Series I. Riders and catering information
Series II. Ledgers and receipt books

processinfo.p: Dates given for the folders are the dates for the concert or rehearsal. When material from one band was found in the folder of another, it was moved and a note made of its original location.
Russ Taft and David Mead material found in this folder was moved to folder (1-78).

scopecontent.p: Seattle Paramount, Seattle Arena, Northwest Airlines

processinfo.p: Neil Diamond event found in this fold was moved to folder (1-93)
Simple Minds rider (photocopied, April 8, 1983 concert) moved to Simple Minds folder (1-77).
Rider for April 8, 1983 concert moved from Bob Seger folder (1-76).

scopecontent.p: Ledgers contain names of bands and dates of events.
